messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the JAX-RS (RESTEasy) with Netty as HTTP transport framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `src/main/java/com/datastax/mgmtapi/resources/AuthResources.java`, I found that `AuthResources.createRole` is implemented to process HTTP requests to the path `/api/v0/ops/auth/role`. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full request path
- /api/v0/ops/auth/role/

All HTTP methods acceptable?
- No

HEAD
- No

POST
- Yes

OPTIONS
- No

TRACE
- No

GET
- No

PUT
- No

DELETE
- No

PATCH
- No

Explanation
- The resource class is annotated with @Path("/api/v0/ops/auth") and the method createRole is annotated with @Path("/role/"), so the combined endpoint path is /api/v0/ops/auth/role/ (leading slash included as required).
- The createRole method is annotated only with @POST (javax.ws.rs.POST). There are no other HTTP method annotations (@GET, @PUT, @DELETE, @PATCH, @HEAD, @OPTIONS, @TRACE) on this method or class that would make other methods acceptable. Per the instructions, acceptability is determined from the code (annotations), not runtime/container behavior, so only POST is accepted.
- The method produces text/plain and expects query parameters username, is_superuser, can_login, and password; it returns 200 ("OK") on success or 400 when username/password are blank (as shown by the code and @ApiResponse annotations).
